thread.title: thoughts on anyland

comments.text: i don't really have a problem with most of the bugs i've encountered in this game. a lot of the time it's more about how people abuse them, but it's hardly stopped me making things
i've gotten used to moving to were i want to go when building my worlds since 'auto-teleporting to the nearest object you point to' is pretty unhelpful half the time...
someone is likely to tell me 'there's an option to turn it off' or 'just use playspace mover'. i don't really understand the second one properly but it doesn't seem right to use it
phillip should really have a proper no-clip button for editors though. making a multi-level cave is probably the hardest thing i've tried to do so far...
trying to teleport to a specific spot in the cave shouldn't be a game of pinball.
i genuinly like most of the people in anyland. it has a lot of character and -due to the small player base- the drama is pretty minimal and harmless...
i'm likely going to say the wrong thing at some point and have a bunch of people hate me, but i'm pretty comfortable being isolated since it give's me more time to make stuff.
i'm genuinly thankfull that this game has a trashcan and an undo button. these 2 things have probably saved 100 hours of work that would otherwise be lost forever.
philipp plz let me out of my mountin home. non of my teleporters are working anymore.
found a bug that shrunk every section of my wall buy 1inch on all sides when i c.l. it. had to shift every section back into place and even re-do a few parts.
'invisible' objects show up in mirrors. would it be more appropriate to re-name it to 'ghosting'? probably good for scary maps either way.
was just reminded that duping somthing you are holding shrinks it if your'e bigger than normal. the effect stacks if you dupe the duped object in the same way.
considering the amount of problems i'm getting with steamvr fuggering up the audio, anyland problems seem a lot more bareable now.
my idea for large 'open' maps with detail; build the landscape first with large, low-poly shapes with unlimited render. add smaller shapes ontop with limited render.
continued from previous - small shapes being a higher poly landscape that covers the low poly.
going full invisible mode so i can focus more on my stuff. i really want to get a good chunk of stuff started and finished...
...for anyone who thinks i'm wasting my life on this, i was spending up to 10 hours (after work) just sat at the screen looking at re-used &unfunny meme's or pointless videos
i may be still at the computer doing this but at least i have something to show for it.
this probably applies to most communities but: isn't it funny how the most important events can occur when you're gone? it seems like a good reason to get upset at inoccent people.
i have many ideas still but little ambition to go through with a lot of them. i would like to avoid my friends for the sake of getting projects finished. this isn't their fault.
i've hardly had any motivation to do anything for over half a year now. i really want to continue but i need to fix my current lifestyle...
...i have barely enough energy to do my job as it is and i still have some drive to get stuff finished here.
i'm a lot less likely to hang around people if i am staying. i think it's safe to say i've seen the social patterns enough.
noticed that cheap trick of phasing through objects is finally fixed. too bad teleport guns still work.
kind of getting cheesed off again. some people need to understand that being 'better at the game' doesn't mean you have to rub it in our faces. i might be a hipocrit though. i duno
this game continues to be played less frequently but i'm alright with that in a sense? i wouldn't want it to die but i'm always a bit of a shut in when things get a bit crazy tbh.
a lot of people have pointed out how disapointed they are in philip and i can't pick sides here. no one outright wants him to stop though but there's lessons to be learned from it.
